title: Arc Furnace
content: The **Arc Furnace** is a machine used to remelt whole blocks into different or more pure materials ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the copper block as shown in building tutorial **Power Input:** On top of the coil **Power Consumption:** 16MW during operation ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/FT7tKqH ## Recipes To smelt blocks, place them inside the furnace {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Cobblestone |Magma Block |- |Stone |Magma Block |- |Magma Block |Lava |- |Wet Sponge |Sponge |- |Sand |Glass |- |T.N.T. |Diamond Block™ |- |Sculk Catalyst |Budding Amethyst |- |Sculk |Cobweb |- |Smooth Stone |Deepslate |- |Cobbled Deepslate |Gravel |- |Calcite |Quartz Block |- |Polished Deepslate |Basalt |- |Blackstone |Tuff |- |Raw Copper Block |Copper Block |- |Raw Gold Block |Gold Block |- |Raw Iron Block |Iron Block |} <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4</small></sub></code>

title: Battery Array
content: The **Battery Array** is a modular multiblock structure that is able to store and contain energy that is produced. The structure is able to expand with more energy storage by adding [Battery Modules](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Battery_Module) which is made in the [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the anvil **Power Input:** Into the HVC Blocks **Power Output:** Into the HVC Blocks **Power Capacity:** Dependent on battery count

title: Block Breaker
content: The **Block Breaker** is a multiblock machine that is used to break blocks that is in front of the observer. As similar to the [Block Placer](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Placer), it does not require the use of power to be inputted into the system. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the dispenser **Activation:** Whenever a block is placed in front of the observer ## Operations The **Block Breaker** will monitor if there is a block that is in front of the observer. Once detected, it will proceed to break the block and insert the dropped item in the dispenser.

title: Block Placer
content: The **Block Placer** is a mutliblock machine that is used to place blocks in front of the dispenser. As similar to the [Block Breaker](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Breaker), it does not require the use of power to be inputted into the system. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the dispenser **Activation:** Whenever a block is inside the dispenser. ## Operations To use the **Block Placer**, you will need to place a block inside the dispenser for the multiblock to activate and place the block.

title: Blog:Recent posts
content: <bloglist summary#"true" count50><title>⧼create-blog-post-recent-listing-title ⧽</title><type>plain</type><order>date</order></bloglist>

title: Breakers
content: **Breakers** are machines used to turn on and restabilize the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [D.E.M.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M)<br> They are able to divert power to a reactor for powering up machines such as the power lasers on the [D.E.M.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M) ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the piston **Power Input:** HV Slab under the piston **Power Output:** HV Slab above the piston **Power Throughput:** Varies **Activation:** Provide enough power and activate all 15 stone buttons. ## Breaker Operations It is recommended to setup a manual power distribution system something similar to the one in the image below. This system is designed to use sticky pistons to push HVC blocks to the general power grid so it can properly allocate power to the breaker without anything else pulling power. [[Image:FacilityBreakers.png|left|470x470px|frameless]] <div style="clear: both;"></div> This can be essential depending on if you are currently not making enough power for all connected machines, such as if a machine needing mass amounts of power is online and pulling the power away from potentially starting or restabilizing an unstable reactor. Just make sure to put it in an easy-to-reach place, easily accessible from your breakers. <!-- Category with machines used to operate the DEM -->

title: Bugs
content: This is a list of all known bugs that are in T.E.R.F ---- # JonaBug It makes you 0.3x the normal size and kicks you when trying to unshrink with an "Internal server error". # SonyBug JonaBug, but you're 0.15x the normal size. ----2. Dem Flight Bug, It gives you infinite levitation until a map reset is called via jona or other sources like a STFR meltdown

title: Charging Station
content: The **Charging Station** is a multiblock machine that is used to charge certain tools durability. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the dropper. **Power Input:** Above the polished blackstone stair. **Power Consumption:** Variable, up to 3,600MW. **Activation:** Place an acceptable tool that has lower durability than the max to begin charging. ## Operations The **Charging Station** will stay dormant until a tool that is acceptable, for example a [Plasma Pickaxe](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Plasma_Pickaxe), and has less durability from the maximum that it can have. Once it turns on, it will pull power from the connected power network and proceed to increase item durability.

title: Crafting table
content: The **Crafting Table** is a machine used to craft items and blocks. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** None needed **Power Input:** Not present **Power Consumption:** Not needed **Activation:** In GUI

title: Crusher
content: The **Crusher** is a multiblock machine that crushes items into dust using pistons. ## Technical **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the bottom hopper **Power Input:** Into the HVC Block **Power Consumption:** 10MW during operation **Activation:** Put an acceptable item into the top hopper ## Operation Firstly put an acceptable item into the top hopper for it to activate. Once it starts, you will begin to hear a crushing sound. You will know when it is finished once the noise stops and there is an item in the bottom hopper of the multiblock. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Blaze Rod | -> | 4x Blaze Powder |- | Stone | -> | Cobblestone |- | Cobblestone | -> | Gravel |- | Gravel | -> | Sand |- | Wool | -> | 4x String |- | Ice | -> | Snowball |- | Packed Ice | -> | 9x Snowballs |- | Bone | -> | 6x Bonemeal |- | Sugar Cane | -> | 2x Sugar |- | T.N.T. | -> | 5x Gunpowder |- | Redstone | -> | Red Dye |- | Amethyst Block | -> | Amethyst Dust |- | Raw Copper | -> | Copper Dust |- | Raw Copper Block | -> | 9x Copper Dust |- | Raw Iron | -> | Iron Dust |- | Raw Iron Block | -> | 9x Iron Dust |- | Raw Gold | -> | Gold Dust |- | Raw Gold Block | -> | 9x Gold Dust |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Dust |- | Netherite Ingots | -> | 4x Netherite Dust |- | Netherite Scrap | -> | Netherite Dust |}

title: Diesel Generator
content: The **Diesel Generator** is a multiblock machine that burns fuel and converts it into 6MW of power. Currently, there is fuel requirement for the **Diesel Generator** so you cannot currently input fuel into the machine. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** The middle piston **Power Output:** Outputs power from the HVC block **Power Production:** 6 MW of power ## Operations Since there is currently no fuel usage from the **Diesel Generator** nor any way to input fuel into the multiblock. The **Diesel Generator** once fully made, will begin to produce power from the HVC block. You will know when the multiblock is working once you begin hearing power emit from the machine and smoke particles begin producing from the dropper.

title: Electric Press
content: The **Electric Press** is a multiblock machine that is used to flatten items with heavy force to convert them into other materials. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** In the middle of the waxed cut copper block **Power Input:** Above top cut copper block **Power Consumption:** 1500 MWt every operation **Activation:** Each operation is activated by powering the piston ## Operations Drop an accepted item on top of the middle waxed cut copper block and insert power into the top piston. Once the piston goes down, it will generate particles. Once redstone power gets removed from the piston, it will dispense the converted item. You can use any forms of redstone power to activate the piston. It is commonly operated with a stone button or a lever. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | 1x Honeycomb | -> | 1x Slimeball |- | 1x Honeycomb Block | -> | 4x Slimeball |- | 8x String | -> | 1x Leather |- | 5x Blaze Powder | -> | 1x Blaze Rod |- | 1x Netherite Scrap | -> | 1x Ancient Debris |}

title: Electrolyzer
content: The **Electrolyzer** is a machine used to convert water into oxygen and hydrogen. <chem display#"inline">H2O -> 2H + O </chem> ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Metal Plating in the center of the machine **Power Input:** Into the HVC Block **Power Consumption:** 15MW **Activation:** Provide input fluids ## Recipes {| class"wikitable" ! Input Fluid ! + ! Processing Time ! -> ! Output 1 ! + ! Output 2 |- | 30mB Water | + | 100 ticks | -> | 20mB Hydrogen | + | 10mB Oxygen |} ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/gallery/electrolyzer-build-tutorial-LAmKmya The multiblock core block has been highlighted in green for clarity

title: Extended Mainframe
content: **Extended Mainframe** is an unreleased addon which makes it easier to connect [server stacks](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mainframe]]_servers. ##_Content_ The_addon_allows_[[Mainframe#Servers) to reach a maximum height of 5 blocks and allows singular servers to be connected via the sides and top. ## Glitches While checks are in place to prevent connecting a server from the sides or top if the server is already connected from the bottom, it is possible to connect a single server 5 times by connecting it via every side and the top at the same time.

title: Fabricator
content: ## Description The **Fabricator** is a multiblock machine utilized to fabricate many tools, parts, and other machines. ## Technical Informaion **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Crafter **Power Input:** Behind the Crafter **Power Consumption:** 100MW during operation **Activation:** Put the required items into the Crafter, then press the button ## Operations Operators place the items into the Crafter in the correct order and then proceed to input redstone power into the blackstone stair. Once the correct item and order is setup, the item count will go down by once and the machine will activate. The **Fabricator** will finish by dispensing the item on top of the Crafter and await another redstone input to begin the process again. ## Recipes ### **Tool parts recipes:** <gallery widths#"210"> File:HighVoltageLaserDiodeRecipe.png|***High-Voltage-Laser-Diode recipe.***' File:LowVoltageLaserDiodeRecipe.png|***Low-Voltage-Laser-Diode recipe.***' File:MediumVoltageBatteryRecipe.png|***Medium-Voltage-Battery recipe.***' File:HeatSinkRecipe.png|***Heat-Sink recipe.***' File:MagnetronRecipe.png|***Magnetron recipe.***' </gallery> ### **Tool recipes:** <gallery widths"210"> File:TauCannonRecipe.png|***Tau-Cannon recipe.***' File:WrenchRecipe.png|***Wrench recipe.***' File:CraneRemoteRecipe.png|***Crane-Remote recipe.***' File:PlasmaPickaxeRecipe.png|***Plasma-Pickaxe recipe.***' File:LinkerRecipe.png|***Linker recipe.***' File:PhotonCannonRecipe.png|***Photon-Cannon recipe.***' File:TaserRecipe.png|***Taser recipe.***' File:LaserPistolRecipe.png|***Laser-Pistol recipe.***' File:MultimeterRecipe.png|***Multimeter recipe.***' File:DosimeterRecipe.png|***Dosimeter recipe.***' File:ShrinkRayRecipe.png|***Shrink-ray recipe.***' File:NeutronBinocularRecipe.png|***Neutron-Binocular recipe.***' </gallery> ### **Machine Recipes:** <gallery widths#"210"> File:MCFRAssemblyRecipe.png|***M.C.F.R. Assembly***' </gallery> ### **Miscellaneous recipes:** <gallery widths"210"> File:HardhatRecipe.png|***Hardhat recipe.***' File:MultiblockCoreRecipe.png|***Multiblock-Core recipe.***' File:BatteryRecipe.png|***Battery recipe.***' File:SyringeRecipe.png|***Syringe recipe.***' File:FluidIDRecipe.png|***Fluid ID recipe.***' </gallery> ### **A.R.T. recipes:** <gallery widths="275"> File:ARTRailRecipe.png|***A.R.T. rail recipe***' File:ARTGunRecipe.png|***A.R.T. gun recipe***' File:ARTHingeRecipe.png|***A.R.T. hinge recipe***' File:ARTBaseRecipe.png|***A.R.T. base recipe***' </gallery>

title: Fission Reactor
content: The **Fission Reactor**, or better known as the **Lambda Core**, is a unobtainable reactor that is only found in the TERF facility. Its purpose is to transmutate blocks from one state to another by emission of neutron radiation changing the material structure. ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Unknown **Power Output:** Unknown **Power Input:** Unknown ## Operations To first begin operating the **Lambda Core** you will need a [Crane Remote](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Crane_Remote), this device will allow you to move the control rod increasing neutron activity. Inside the **Lambda Core**, you will need to change the block configuration to increase the neutron activity. Below is the blocks that can affect the **Lambda Core**: **Iron Blocks:** Absorbs Neutrons **Coal Blocks:** Slows Neutrons **Lapis Blocks:** Reflects Neutrons Be aware, do not get close to the reactor when Control Rods are removed as it can beam severe radiation which may be life threatening. To begin transmutating blocks, you will need to put these blocks in the area of the **Lambda Core** and once irradiated enough, they will begin to transmutate. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input: !Chance of Transmutation: !Output: |- |Ancient Debris | |Diamond Block |- |Copper Block | |Coal Block |- |Gold Block | |Ancient Debris |- |Wheat Crop | |Nether Wart |- |Sandstone | |Soul Sand |- |Oak Sapling | |Pale Oak Sapling |- |Brown Mushroom Block | |Warped Fungus |- |Red Mushroom Block | |Crimson Fungus |- |Dried Ghasts | |Ghast Tear |}

title: Fluid Pump
content: The **Fluid Pump** is a multiblock machine that is used to collect liquids from below. It is commonly used to collect water blocks to input into other machines such as a coolant for the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR) ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the piston **Power Input:** Into the HVC block **Power Consumption:** 3MW **Activation:** A usable liquid found below the cauldron ## Operations Once the multiblock is built, it will begin to search below if there is acceptable liquids, such as water blocks, and collect the block below to input into its system as an example [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water). Once stored, it searches for any connected basalt pipes to pipe the fluid to another location that is able to take in an acceptable fluid. For extracting water blocks, it is recommended to make a infinite water pool so the **Fluid Pump** is able to consistently able to collect water blocks and convert it into [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water). ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Water Source Block | -> | [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water) (1,000mB) |- |}

title: Gold Slurry
content: **Gold Slurry** is a custom fluid made from converting [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Gold_Dust]]_in_a_[Wet_Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill)._The_currently_only_known_use_for_it_is_to_lubricate_the_[STFR) to prevent maintenance. ## Obtaining Firstly, you will require a operational [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR)_to_prevent_maintenance. ##_Obtaining_ Firstly,_you_will_require_a_operational_[S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill)_and_[Crusher](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Crusher)._You_firstly_put_Gold_Ingot's_into_the_[Crusher](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Crusher)_to_crush_gold_into_[Gold_Dust](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Gold_Dust)._Once_you_have_obtained_[Gold_Dust](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Gold_Dust),_you_then_input_it_into_a_[Wet_Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill)._Once_it_has_processed,_you_have_obtained_**Gold_Slurry**_and_you_are_now_available_to_utilize_it_in_another_machine. ##_Uses_ The_current_use_is_for_adding_lubricant_into_the_[[STFR) although more uses may be in development.

title: Hadron Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a machine in the TERF Facility, used to smash items into other items at high speeds to create new items. It is a major part of the [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process). ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards **Power Input:** Into the Interface as seen in tutorial video **Power Consumption(MW):** <math>Length \times 16</math> ## Build Tutorial

title: Large Fabricator
content: The **Large Fabricator** is an unreleased machine.

title: Large Fluid Solidifier
content: The **Large Fluid Solidifier** is a machine that turns liquids, such as [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water), into blocks, such as [Ice](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Ice). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Lapis Block, facing towards the output conveyor belt. **Power Input:** Not needed. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Provide the machine with the correct amount of input liquid. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Fluid (amount mB) ! -> ! Output Block |- | [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water) (1,000 mB) | -> | Ice |- | [Mineral Magma](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mineral_Magma) (1,000 mB) | -> | Coal Ore (~34.5%) <br> Copper Ore (~32.7%) <br> Redstone Ore (~13.5%) <br> Gold Ore (~9.70%) <br> Iron Ore (~3.25%) <br> Diamond Ore (~2.99%) <br> Lapis Ore (~2.91%) <br> Ancient Debris (0.3%) |- |}

title: Large Turbine
content: The **Large Turbine** is a machine used to generate power from [High Pressure Steam](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/High_Pressure_Steam). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the smooth stone **Power Output:** Into the HVC Block **Power Generation:** Variable generation (up to ~1666MW) **Activation:** Provide enough steam

title: Laser-Pistol
content: {{Item|title#Laser Pistol|typeElectronic Optical Handheld Photon Beam Emitter|usage#Shooting stuff|recipe-typeFabricator}} The **Laser Pistol** is a low-yield handheld energy weapon. ## Technical Information **Power Storage:** 500 shots (2,000MWt per shot) **Damage:** 0.4 hearts per shot **Additional Properties:** Projectiles can break blocks and be redirected by observers. They also reset the whitelist of security terminals, playing a unique sound.

title: Machinery
content: ## Introduction: This page lists all current available machines on the Official server. Some machines may change over time or new machines get added so this page might not be up to date at all times! ## Machinery: [Arc Furnace](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Arc_Furnace) [Block Breaker](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Breaker) [Block Placer](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Placer) [Charging Station](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Charging_Station) [Crusher](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Crusher) [Electric Press](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electric_Press) [Electrolyzer](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electrolyzer) [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator) [Fission Reactor](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fission_Reactor) [Hadron Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider) [Mainframe](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mainframe) [Multi Piston](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Multi_Piston) [OpenCore](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/OpenCore) [Physical Connections](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Physical_Connections) [Purifier](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Purifier) [Rolling Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Rolling_Mill) [Wet Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill) [WarpCore](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/WarpCore) [The D.E.M](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M)

title: Magma Drill
content: The **Magma Drill** is a machine that extracts Mineral Magma from Lava. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone. Orientation doesn't matter. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block. **Power Consumption:** 70MW **Activation:** Active by default. Deactivate by moving fluid output. ## Recipes The input structure is a list of blocks, which should be placed from top to bottom. Place the input structure directly below the drill bit, (lightning rod) or the drill bit directly above the input structure. {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Structure ! -> ! Output Fluid |- | 3 Blocks, Lava, Bedrock | -> | Mineral Magma |- |}

title: Mainframe
content: The **Mainframe** is a device used to link machines to each other. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone, facing towards the screens. **Power Input:** Not needed, despite the presence of HVC blocks. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Automatic, can be restarted by removing the multiblock core and adding it back again. ## Servers A Mainframe's usefulness depends on the number of connected servers. Each connected machine "consumes" servers through the mainframe. If you don't have enough servers to fufill the needs of all connected machines, the mainframe will crash, making a unique sound. The mainframe will then restart after 1 minute. To restart a mainframe sooner, remove the multiblock core and add it back again. Each mainframe starts with 2 servers, which are part of the multiblock structure. Additional servers can be added by placing L.O.O.M. servers above HVC blocks connected to the mainframe's own HVC blocks. HVC cables will not work for connecting servers to mainframes. L.O.O.M. servers can also be placed on top of other servers, making a server stack. Up to 3 servers can be in a single stack; additional servers are ignored and considered disconnected from the mainframe. ## Connection Machines can be connected to a Mainframe via [Data Connection](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Physical_Connections#Data_Connection)s. Data Connections are accepted through the waxed cut copper block, found at the bottom of the multiblock structure, as is common with machines that accept a data connection. ## Usage TBC

title: Mineral Magma
content: **Mineral Magma** is a custom liquid produced by [Magma Drill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Magma_Drill)s.

title: Multi Piston
content: The **Multi-Piston** is a machine used to move blocks across short distances. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the dispenser. **Power Input:** Not present. **Power Consumption:** Not needed. **Activation:** Always active, but providing a [Redstone](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Redstone) signal to the dispenser will reverse the direction of travel.

title: Multiblocks
content: ## Summary Multiblocks are the core of TERF, enabling the operation of machines such as the [STFR](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [DEM](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M). This page documents how multiblocks are made and operated. ## The Multiblock Core To create multiblocks, you first need a multiblock core. These can be made with the crafting table using the following recipe, or, once you have made a power generator and a [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator), you can use the more efficient fabricator recipe.

title: Non-Formal Template
content: {{DISPLAYTITLE:Template:Non-Formal Template}}

title: OpenCore
content: The OpenCore is a furnace that uses two positron emission units to remelt items many times more efficiently than basic methods. Use of OpenCore can consume from 1000MWh to 10000MWh ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the iron blocks at the bottom **Power Input:** Into the conductor blocks ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/RC9NZsx Note than the upper part is 4 blocks above the bottom part ##Usage To use OpenCore you need active S.T.F.R which produces more than 500 MWh (Varies depending on the recipe) {| class="wikitable" !Ingredient !Energy (MWh) !Result |- |8x Netherite Scrap |5000 |8x Netherite Ingot |- | 32x Glowstone Dust |2000 |24x Blaze Powder |- |4x Emerald Block |7200 |3x Diamond Block |- | 20x Quartz |900 |20x Amethyst Shards |- |4x Amethyst Block |6000 |1x Ochre Froglight |- |1x Netherite Block |10000 |1x Heavy Core |} If you meet the requirements, you can start-up OpenCore and start using it. After confirming start-up sequence, you will start getting temperature "orders" you need to meet. You can find them at sign above centre of control panel. If you fail to meet order you will face consequences. If recipe was simple (froglight, amethyst shards, blaze powder) you will just get small explosion/photons, else, if there was difficult recipe (netherite ingots, diamond blocks, heavy core) you will get medium/large explosion. Full tutorial: https://youtu.be/xkQwBeZJXUA <small>*Written by LogicLogger*</small> <small>*Corrections & build tutorial by Sony*</small>

title: Physical Connections
content: Most machines will need some physical connection to other machines, whether it's electrical, fluidic or digital. ## Basic Behaviour All connections connect in the same way, using omnidirectional connecting blocks and directed connecting blocks * **Omnidirectional Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will input and output from any side * **Directed Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will only input or output from two opposite sides ## Types <gallery> File:ElectricWires.webp|Electric Cables File:HotFluidPipe.webp|Hot Fluid Pipe File:ColdFluidPipe.webp|Cold Fluid Pipe File:DataConnection.webp|Data Connection </gallery> ### Electrical Cables * Used to electrically connect machines * Transfers electric power ### Hot Fluid Pipe * Used to connect the S.T.F.R. and Turbines * Transports Steam and Mineral Magma ### Cold Fluid Pipe * Used to connect Coolant Pumps and Turbines to S.T.F.R. * Transports Coolant ### Data Connection * Used to connect control panels and multiblock machines, usually operated by a mainframe <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub> __NOEDITSECTION__

title: Pressurizer
content: If the Pressurizer has oxygen it pressurizes an enclosed area ## Logistics **Multiblock core placement:** in the vent block on top, cut copper must be placed first, then the multiblock, then the vent block. {| class="wikitable" |+Fluid/Gas logistics: !Input fluid: !Storage capacity: |- |2mb of Oxygen/s |30mb of oxygen |}

title: Purifier
content: The **Purifier** is a machine that turns blocks into other blocks by bathing them in water. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the piston while facing the opposite direction that the piston is **Power Input:** Behind the piston **Power Consumption:** 5MW during operation **Activation:** Place the input blocks underneath the iron bars ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input ! -> ! Result |- | Stone | -> | Calcite |- | Basalt | -> | Blackstone |- | Red Sandstone | -> | Netherrack |}

title: Rolling Mill
content: The **Rolling Mill** is a machine used to roll ingots into plates. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** In the center of the multiblock structure, at the bottom, facing towards the output hopper. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block below the input hopper. **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation. **Activation:** Put the input item into the input hopper. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Iron Ingot | -> | Iron Plate |- | Copper Ingot | -> | Copper Plate |- | Netherite Ingot | -> | Netherite Plate |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Plate |- | Uranium Ingot | -> | Uranium Plate |- | Plutonium Ingot | -> | Plutonium Plate |- |}

title: S.T.F.R. Logistics
content: WIP ## Technicals **Maximum Steam Output:** *Unknown,* conventionally used to generate 30 000 m°C/t of steam ### **Physical Connections:** #### Coolant Input Requires a constant source of coolant, it is recommended to connect the coolant pump to steam turbine coolant output to create an efficient loop #### Steam Output Steam is to be directed into turbines, each turbine can handle 5000 m°C/t of steam #### Mainframe Connection Must be linked with control panel in Mainframe #### Breaker Connection There must be a connection from breaker output to one of the stabilizers to enable startup and restabilization ## Build Tutorial The multiblock core goes into the end of the bottom stabilizer <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4 & Corrstud01</small></sub></code> __NOEDITSECTION____INDEX__ __NONEWSECTIONLINK__

title: S.T.F.R. Restabilization
content: ## Introduction: This page will explain all types of Critical Reactor Core states and their Restabilizations. All Critical Core states are caused by failing Shield Integrity. ## Overload: An Overload is usually caused by Reactor Core stats being out of safety parameters. Once a Reactor Overloads, all Core stats will run out of control as the Stabilizers are no longer able to contain the Core. The Case will start burning from the Heat and the Core will start to shoot beams of light. Stabilizer U and D currently do not have any connections they need and can be freely connected to. Your breaker input Stabilizer needs to be connected to and your mainframe connector input Stabilizer need to be connected. This also means your console will not work for the time being. Once all 4 Stabilizers are connected the reactor will automatically initiate a restabilization Power Surge. '''<u>Do not forget to reconnect your Controller or you won't be able to control your reactor</u>'''. <u>Again, a Power Surge will make your controls multiply by 10x!</u> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSJJZMk50MU ## Notes: * Shield Integrity will rapidly decrease if all stabilizers are broken while the Reactor is online. * During a Power Surge the Core will have 10x natural heating! ## Trivia: * Underload is also reffered to as Freezedown/Reactor Stall by the Community but Underload is the official name in the files <code><sub><small>Composed by Cooocki</small></sub></code>

title: S.T.F.R. Startup
content: Please note that this page is **<big>WIP</big>** Keep in mind that this guide is written specifically for the official map, while most of the steps will be applicable for a custom built setup, a few steps are reserverd specificallly for the official map In the meantime, you can refer to this fan-made Quick start tutorial PDF ### 5. Step - Press the SSTB button again This will initiate reactor ignition and start the core ## Common issues you might encounter ### *Breakers do not work* This can be caused by insufficient power directed to the breakers as they need atleast 24 MW of power, alternatively could be caused by breaker output connnection not being connected to the S.T.F.R. <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub>

title: S.T.F.R Stabilization
content: ## S.T.F.R. Controls The operation of the S.T.F.R. can initially look complicated at first glace. Firstly, the image below is the general control area that you will operate the reactor. if this occurs. ## Maximum S.T.F.R. Values <b>Core Spin</b>: 80,000 - 150,000 RPM <b>Core Temperature</b>: 15,000 - 110,000 °C <b>Core Pressure</b>: 280,000 kPa <b>Case Pressure</b>: 80,000 kPa <b>Case Temperature</b>: 1,000 °C ## S.T.F.R. Logistics For every 5000 RPM of <b>Core Spin</b> will give you 1% of <b>MSSR</b>, <b>Magnetic Shield Stress Reduction</b>, this will decrease <b>Shield Stress</b> that is made by Core and Case Temperature, Pressure, and <b>Core Spin</b> by 1%. It is recommended for <b>Core Pressure</b> to be double of <b>Core Temperature</b>. It is also recommended to monitor the <b>Fuel Usage</b> to match the rate of <b>Fuel Injection</b>. The amount of <b>Case Pressure</b> affects the <b>Heat Transfer Rate</b> (<b>HTR</b>) between the core and the case. For every 3m°C/t is equal to 1MW. One turbine can only handle 5000m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. The Troty Energy Research Facility have 6 turbines which adds up to 30k m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. It is preferred to keep <b>Cooling Lasers</b> off unless your <b>Case Pressure</b> is below 15-20 kPa.

title: Testing page (Do not touch)
content: The WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. ## Logistics: **Power consumption:** 10,000 MW/t per block. **Power storage:** 2,000,000 MW ## WarpCore Guide: Place the multiblock core in the WarpCore FACING the mainframe connection. The multiblock core for the panel goes facing towards the screens

title: The AEG
content: **The AEG** is a team. ## Member List * [User:BraveCaperCat](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/User:BraveCaperCat) - Team Leader & Founder * [User:Diena1rah](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/User:Diena1rah) - Not yet decided

title: The C.R.R.
content: ## Description The **Catalyzed Redstone Reactor** or **C.R.R.** is an addon to the TERF datapack. Designed to be the second reactor after the [M.C.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/MCFR) utilizing the Helium-4 that it produces. It is a Matter Conversion Reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. The **C.R.R.** has three different parts, the Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and the Projector. You will need to constantly add Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls to the **C.R.R.** to keep it operational. ## C.R.R. Operations To begin the startup process, you will need to input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB of Helium-4 into the **C.R.R.** Be aware, there can be a 5% chance for the **C.R.R.** to potentially have a Startup Failure. The controls below describes what they affect. **Saturation Extraction Rate** - The rate that the Energy Collector extracts Saturation<br> **Catalyzer Injection** - Increases C. Catalyzer<br> **™B Projection** - Reduces Shield Stress by using up more F. Shield ## Emergency Operations ### Meltdown Core Temperature will increase the **C.R.R.**'s Shield Stress. If the Shield Stress reaches above 100%, it will begin to degrade the shield. Increasing Saturation Extraction Rate and decreasing Catalyzer Injection may help to decrease stress. You can also use Catalyzer Annihilation to decrease Saturation.<br> If you also run out of F. Shield, this will also cause the shield to degrade.<br> Once the shield breaks, this begins the process of the second stage of meltdown. You will need to perform restabilization before the **C.R.R.** reaches stage three meltdown. You will need to input water into the **C.R.R.**, activate Catalyzer Annihilation, and injecting reaction inhibitor, once these are completed it will proceed to shut down the **C.R.R.** <br> If you fail to input water and use the Catalyzer Annihilation, the **C.R.R.** will reach stage three meltdown, it is best to evacuate the area as the core is unable to be saved. The **C.R.R.** will begin to leak out rays that can injure personnel and damage the area around it. After a while, the reactor will blow up and leave behind a crater. ### Stall If you run out of C. Redstone or have 0% saturation, the reactor may begin to stall. Unlike the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR), this will not lead to the reactor freezing. It will then give you two options: remove the key and shut down the reactor or reignite the reactor again. ### Startup Failure There is a 5% change for startup failure to occur. If this does happen, this will start to cause the shield to form unstable, to prevent the **C.R.R.** from summoning a Resonance Cascade, you will need to kill the green particles that fly around the room. Once they have been all removed, the **C.R.R.** will return to normal operation. ## C.R.R. Logistics There is no limit for Core Temp but the higher it goes, the more Shield Stress is gained. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, and Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer when it is low. ## Trivia The **C.R.R.** was inspired by the Anti Mass Spectrometer from the Half-Life series and the Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod. The **C.R.R** wasn't developed by Jona, instead it was coded by Cooocki and built by Kaiden

title: The D.E.M
content: The D.E.M. is a black hole based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. # A massive warning that the info in the dem page is incorrect because it literally spreads misinformation ### Structure add a gallery when you get evenly square versions of the individual compopnents of the D.E.M. Component List of images to add * Proper Square Full Render * Core * Horizon Scrubber * Power Laser * Power Extractors * Stabilizer * Startup Manifold (Only if its easy to get) #### Core * This is the black hole core of the D.E.M. where hawking radiation for power generation comes from * This is only present while the D.E.M. is in operations, or as a ball of compressed matter during startup, which then gets compressed by gravitational amplification * The core is kept stable using a gravity shield that prevents the gravity of the black hole from extending past intended boundaries * The core is generally being orbited by the accretion disc, which is the disc of matter falling into the core to generate power, this disc can stall if complete desaturation is allowed, but the accretion disc can simply be reformed #### Horizon Scrubber * Prevents the atmosphere inside the room from reaching into the accretion disc, which would uncontrollably saturate the disc, potentially destabilizing the gravity shield by throwing core parameters out of control * It does not prevent anything from falling into it, allowing the accretion disc to be resaturated during operations using any form of matter #### Power Lasers * Stabilizes one part of the D.E.M.'s Operation, wether it'd be the accretion disc's rotational energy or thermal energy, or causing EMR flux in the core or feeding it some mass #### Power Extractors * Extracts power from the core using the emitted hawking radiation, due to how accelerated the hawking radiation decay process is, this generates a lot of power #### Stabilizers * Stabilizes the gravitational shield, preventing the black hole from tearing the facility and the planet apart #### Startup Manifold * Generates the accretion disc ### Operation Parameters #### Global Laser Offset * Offsets the lasers from the singularity of the core, eventually changing their modes across 4 different overall modes # Extremely Low Offset: Feeds the singularity directly, slightly increasing core mass # Low Offset: Enters the EMRIRS Without hitting the singularity, causing superradiant scattering within the EMRIRS and eventually exiting back out as EMR Flux # Medium Offset: Low leverage on the accretion disc, warming it up more than it adds rotational energy to it # High Offset: High leverage on the accretion disc, adding rotational energy more than it warms it up #### Global Power Laser * Acts as a general multiplier to the effect of the current laser offset's mode #### EMRIR Shield Density * Increases EMR Flux ** This would increase the accretion disc temperature based on how high this gets ** This would decrease the gravity shield's stress based on how high this gets #### Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage * Decreases Accretion Disc Saturation ** This decreases core spin due to having less matter to fall into the core *** This is also based on how fast the disc is spinning * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Field Compression Control * Increases hawking radiation by reducing core mass ** This increases power generation * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Electron Injection * Increases Reactor Charge ** This causes higher disc de-saturation ** This causes lightning bolt strike if get too high ( 9000-12000 ) ## Crucial Components <gallery> File:Mainframe.webp|The Main Computer File:DEMControlPanel.png|The Control Panel </gallery> ### Control Panel * Used to operate the D.E.M. * Is disconnected from the D.E.M. during meltdown phase 2 ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network ## Trivia # The D.E.M.'s full name is "Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor", SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR For short. ## Related Links Cooocki and FJSAGS have put together some notes on how D.E.M. works: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JwTdfeakhBpCm71j09fPvbVEmozJ9vUW4yS5e0n3jAc?tab=t.0

title: The M.C.F.R
content: ## Description The **Modular Catalyzed Fusion Reactor**, or the **M.C.F.R.**, is the first reactor intended for players to reach in their progression. It is a boiling water reactor that uses hydrogen in reaction with water to produce heavy steam and helium-4, the latter of which is used in [The C.R.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_C.R.R.) The **M.C.F.R.** is made of 3 main parts. A **M.C.F.R.** 'slab' refers to a single layer of M.C.F.R. Assemblies, with the picture to the side showing a 5-slab **M.C.F.R.** The **M.C.F.R.** also has top and bottom components, used for I/O, including input power for preheating, hydrogen input, water input and steam output. At least one of each of these must be present, however multiple can be present.{{Needs_Confirmation}} If any of these inputs are not properly added or removed, the **M.C.F.R.** could potentially enter an over-pressure state, causing damage to ventilation. If the vent breaks, and the operator is unable to fix it in time, the **M.C.F.R.** will explode. The explosion size scales with how much hydrogen you have in the system and can be fatal to nearby operators. It is important to also remove helium-4 from the **M.C.F.R.** as it contributes to overall pressure. You can route helium-4 into a tank or smokestack if needed. **Warning**: If helium-4 is ventilated in the environment, it may cause suffocation.{{Needs_Confirmation}}Please set up proper disposal of helium-4. Below is a diagram of a **M.C.F.R.** setup:

title: The S.O.L.A.R.O.S
content: **The S.O.L.A.R.O.S.** is a currently unreleased machine used to create [Antimatter](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Antimatter). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Unknown **Power Input:** Unknown **Power Consumption:** Unknown, likely massive **Size:** "there is no way it fits in your render distance" -Jona

title: The S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R. is a fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility ## Structure <gallery> File:STFRrender.webp|The entire S.T.F.R. File:STFRCaseRender.webp|The case of the S.T.F.R. File:Area render 11 .webp|The core of the S.T.F.R's during operation File:StabiliserRender.webp|One of six of the S.T.F.R's stabilisers </gallery> The S.T.F.R. consists of 6 Stabilisers, a Case and the Core. #### Core * This is the core of fusion reaction, where the main processes happen * This core is only present inside the superstructure when the reactor is in operation * The core consists of a shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core * The shield layer consists of one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields #### Case * The encasing superstructure is a sphere-like structure around the core of the reactor * As the core generates heat during operation, the heat is transferred to the case, where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines to generate power #### Stabilisers * The stabilisers play a crucial role in keeping the core in a stable state and preserving the integrity of core shields ## Crucial Components <gallery> File:BreakersRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Electrical Breakers File:CoolantPumpRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Coolant Pump File:ControlPanel.webp|S.T.F.R. Control Panel File:LargeTurbine.webp|Large Turbine </gallery> ### Breakers * The breakers supply the S.T.F.R. with DC current * The__INDEX__y are only needed during startup or restabilisation * AC current is input at the bottom conductor; DC is output from the top conductor ### Coolant Pump * This pump pumps the coolant for the S.T.F.R. ### Control Panel * Used to operate the S.T.F.R. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network ### Turbine and generator * Upon heating up the [https://terf.fandom.com/wiki/The_S.T.F.R#Case reactor case], steam is produced and can be directed into turbines to generate power * Turbines have to be connected with steam pipes to the S.T.F.R. * Turbines have to be connected with coolant pipes to the S.T.F.R. <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub>

title: Vent Block
content: The **Vent Block** is a block used in the construction of various multiblock structures, notably [The M.C.F.R](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_M.C.F.R). ## Crafting The Vent Block is crafted using the following Crafting Table recipe:

title: WarpCore
content: The **WarpCore** is a machine capable of teleporting almost anything between long distances and/or dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. It is inspired by "The Spire" from Portal: Revolution. ## Construction The primary challenge of building a WarpCore is getting the 32 Netherite Blocks. Everything else is obtainable from the overworld facility's storage. The challenges of building a WarpCore Control Panel and an appropriate mainframe to connect the two, along with a ship to house all 3 devices, are secondary in comparison, though the mainframe tends to be the hardest non-primary challenge, due to the relatively expensive cost of [L.O.O.M Mainframe Server](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/L.O.O.M_Mainframe_Server)s. ### Full Resource List * **Netherite**: **32 Blocks** (see [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process)) * **Copper Coils** * **Ancient Debris** * **High Voltage Conductor Slabs** * **High Voltage Conductor Walls** * **Iron Bars** * **Decorated Pots** ### Build Tutorial The **WarpCore** is both vertically and horizontally symmetric, aside from the mainframe connection. 10 of the WarpCore's layers, the top 5 and bottom 5 layers, have these rings, made out of HVC walls and iron bars.

title: Water
content: **Water** is a custom liquid used as coolant for [The S.T.F.R](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [The M.C.F.R](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_M.C.F.R).

title: Wet Mill
content: This machine is used to pulverize fine crushed materials into very fine dust ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the pot **Power Input:** In the Conductor Block **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation **Fluid Extraction:** Fluids are extracted below the decorated pot via. copper pipes **Cauldrons:** The cauldrons have to be full of water ## Recipes Items are inserted into the input hopper {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Gold Dust |Gold Slurry |- |*More recipes* |*Soon* |} <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4</small></sub></code>

title: Wrench
content: ## Description The wrench is a tool that is used for changing block rotation and is also used for maintenance for the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR) ## Usage ### Maintenance While the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR) is online and there is no lubricant in the system, maintenance may occur and you will require to use a wrench to fix it. You will need to hold your place block button (normally right click) and point your cursor to the source of the particles. You will know if it worked once you hear hammering sounds and the particle source moves. ### Block Rotation If you hold your wrench and activate your place block button (normally right click), you can change the rotation of an item. This affects things such as stairs, trapdoors, and many other blocks. ## Fabrication To fabricate the Wrench, you will need to have a power source and a [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator). The recipe is two iron nuggets, iron pressure plate, iron ingot, lightning rod, and red dye. The location to place the items are in the picture below. <br>
